opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class Mapping

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.alignment.Mapping
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Mapping>
public class Mapping
extends Object
implements Comparable<Mapping>

A mapping from an index in the A phrase position to an index in the B phrase position. Mappings are interpreted as the individual pairs that make up an Alignment from one Phrase to another. This class implements Comparable so that mappings can be easily sorted (see the compareTo(Mapping) method).

Although different encoding schemes may use different index bases, all mappings share a common one, namely Alignments.DEFAULT_INDEX_BASE. As such, no index can be specified that is less than the null value of that index base. Similarly, the phrase number specified (if any) must be in the range of the default phrase number base, even though different encoding schemes may have different phrase number bases.

Since some encoding schemes do not require an phrase number to be specified, the phrase number field may be null. However, none of the other fields may be null. To specify that the mapping is to the special null word value, the default index base's null value is used.

Author:
Scott Martin
See Also:
PhrasePosition, EncodingScheme, IndexBase, Alignments.DEFAULT_PHRASE_NUMBER_BASE, Alignments.DEFAULT_INDEX_BASE, Alignments.DEFAULT_STATUS, Alignments.DEFAULT_CONFIDENCE

Mapping

public Mapping(Integer phraseNumber,
               Integer a,
               Integer b,
               Status status,
               Double confidence)
Creates a mapping between the two specified indices.

Parameters:
phraseNumber - The phrase number of the corresponding mapping.
a - The A index, corresponding to PhrasePosition.A.
b - The B index, corresponding to PhrasePosition.B.
status - The status of this mapping.
confidence - This mapping's confidence value.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException - If any of phraseNumber, a, or b is out of bounds according to the corresponding default.
IllegalArgumentException - If either index is null, or if status or confidence is null.
See Also:
Alignments.DEFAULT_PHRASE_NUMBER_BASE, Alignments.DEFAULT_INDEX_BASE
Method Detail

copyWithPhraseNumber

public Mapping copyWithPhraseNumber(Integer phraseNumber)
Gets a copy of this mapping with its phrase number set to the specified phrase number. This method is a convenience for the MappingReader class, which, for certain encoding scheme like MosesEncodingScheme, may not be able to parse the phrase number from the input string.

Parameters:
phraseNumber - The phrase number the returned mapping should have.
Returns:
This mapping if its phrase number is null and the specified phrase number is null, or if this mapping's phrase number is equivalent to the specified phrase number. Otherwise, a new mapping is returned with all the same field values as this mapping, but with its phrase number set to phraseNumber.
See Also:
Mapping(Integer, Integer, Integer, Status, Double)

mappingByPosition

public static Mapping mappingByPosition(Integer phraseNumber,
                                        Integer a,
                                        Integer b,
                                        PhrasePosition firstPosition)
Convenience method for creating mappings when the phrase position may possibly be PhrasePosition.B.

See Also:
mappingByPosition(Integer, Integer, Integer, Status, Double, PhrasePosition)

mappingByPosition

public static Mapping mappingByPosition(Integer phraseNumber,
                                        Integer a,
                                        Integer b,
                                        Status status,
                                        Double confidence,
                                        PhrasePosition firstPosition)
Convenience method for creating mappings in case which index should be A and which should be B depends on the phrase position.

Parameters:
phraseNumber - The phrase number to use.
a - The index to use either for the A (if the first position is PhrasePosition.A) or B index (if the first position is PhrasePosition.B).
b - The index to use either for the B (if the first position is PhrasePosition.A) or A index (if the first position is PhrasePosition.B).
status - The status to use.
confidence - The confidence to use.
firstPosition - Which phrase position the new mapping should reflect. If this argument is PhrasePosition.A, the a argument will be the A index and the b argument the B. If it is PhrasePosition.B, these are reversed.
Returns:
A new mapping with its indices configured per the specified firstPosition.
See Also:
Mapping(Integer, Integer, Integer, Status, Double)

reverse

public Mapping reverse()
Gets a new mapping just like this one except that the indices in the PhrasePosition.A and PhrasePosition.B positions are swapped. The original status and confidence are unchanged.

Returns:
A mapping with indices reversed.
See Also:
mappingByPosition(Integer, Integer, Integer, Status, Double, PhrasePosition)

Gets this mapping's index at the specified phrase position.

Parameters:
pos - The phrase position at which to return the corresponding index.
Returns:
If pos is PhrasePosition.A, the A index; otherwise the B index.

compareTo

public int compareTo(Mapping o)
Compares this mapping to another according to their natural ordering. The natural ordering of mappings is that first their IDs are compared, then their A indices, then their B indices, and finally their status and confidence value (in that order).

For the ID field, which may be null, the comparison is performed as follows. If both this mapping's ID and the other's are null, they are considered equivalent. If this mapping's ID is non-null, it is compared to the (possibly null) other mapping's ID via Integer.compareTo(Integer).

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable<Mapping>

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Computes a hash code based on the ID, and A and B indices. The status and confidence fields are not used for hash code computation because they are mutable. Because of this, two mappings may have identical hash codes but not be equivalent according to equals(Object).

Overrides:
hashCode in class Object

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Tests whether this mapping is equal to another.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Returns:
true If this mapping's fields match the other according to the corresponding equals methods. For the phrase number field, they are considered equal if both null or if their corresponding equals method returns true, unequal otherwise.

toString

public String toString()
A string representation of this mapping's indices.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
For a mapping with a A index of 3 and a B index of 6, this method gives the string "3 <-> 6".
